author: Amanda Goh
title: Get The Best Hairy Crabs In Singapore At These 9 Restaurants
text:
We’re well into hairy crab season in Singapore and fans of this prized crustacean are in for a treat as chefs around the island have dreamed up a selection of dishes that put the spotlight on the seasonal delicacy.
Also known as Chinese mitten crabs, this freshwater crab is coveted for its juicy flesh and rich, buttery roe. Hairy crab season typically runs from October to December, when these crustaceans reach their peak flavour and texture. Both male and female varieties are used throughout the season. While these autumn delicacies are traditionally steamed and enjoyed with vinegar, various chefs have begun serving up their own take on the dish.
Also read our story on Michelin-rated food in Singapore for 24 hours.
This season, we see Madame Fan infusing the crab with a blend of American ginseng, chrysanthemum and luo han guo; while Yì by Jereme Leung elevates the delicacy with lemongrass and garlic. Traditionalists won’t be left out as restaurants like Man Fu Yuan and Li Bai Cantonese Restaurant are offering beautifully steamed crustaceans alongside unique renditions. Whether you have a penchant for classics or are looking to try something new, we share some of the best restaurants to visit for a taste of the seasonal hairy crab.
